Title: 1. E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
Description: A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape from Earth and return to his home planet.

Title: 2. Tootsie
Description: Michael Dorsey, an unsuccessful actor, disguises himself as a woman in order to get a role on a trashy hospital soap.

Title: 3. An Officer and a Gentleman
Description: A young man must complete his work at a Navy Officer Candidate School to become an aviator, with the help of a tough Gunnery Sergeant and his new girlfriend.

Title: 4. Rocky III
Description: Rocky faces the ultimate challenge from a powerful new contender, and must turn to a former rival to help regain his throne as the undisputed fighting champion.

Title: 5. Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
Description: With the assistance of the Enterprise crew, Admiral Kirk must stop an old nemesis, Khan Noonien Singh, from using the life-generating Genesis Device as the ultimate weapon.

Title: 6. 48 Hrs.
Description: A hard-nosed cop reluctantly teams up with a wise-cracking criminal temporarily paroled to him in order to track down a killer.

Title: 7. Poltergeist
Description: A family's home becomes the center of paranormal activity that opens a doorway to the "other side." With help, they must cross over to get their daughter back.

Title: 8. The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
Description: A town's Sheriff and regular patron of a historical whorehouse fights to keep it running when a television reporter targets it as the Devil's playhouse.

Title: 9. Annie
Description: A spunky young orphan is taken in by a rich eccentric, much to the chagrin of the cantankerous woman who runs the orphanage.

Title: 10. The Verdict
Description: An outcast, alcoholic Boston lawyer sees the chance to salvage his career and self-respect by taking a medical malpractice case to trial rather than settling.

Title: 11. Gandhi
Description: The life of the lawyer who became the famed leader of the Indian revolts against the British rule through his philosophy of nonviolent protest.

Title: 12. First Blood
Description: A veteran Green Beret is forced by a cruel Sheriff and his deputies to flee into the mountains and wage an escalating one-man war against his pursuers.

Title: 13. The Toy
Description: An underemployed reporter finds himself literally purchased as a toy for a rich spoiled brat.

Title: 14. Firefox
Description: A retired air force pilot is sent into the Soviet Union on a mission to steal a prototype jet fighter that can be partially controlled by neuralink.

Title: 15. The Dark Crystal
Description: On another planet in the distant past, a Gelfling embarks on a quest to find the missing shard of a magical crystal, and to restore order to his world.

Title: 16. Conan the Barbarian
Description: A powerful warrior seeks to avenge the genocide of his people and the murder of his parents at the hands of a snake cult.

Title: 17. The Sword and the Sorcerer
Description: A mercenary with a three-bladed sword rediscovers his royal heritage's dangerous future when he is recruited to help a princess foil the designs of a brutal tyrant and a powerful sorcerer in conquering a land.

Title: 18. Best Friends
Description: After five successful years of living and working together, a couple decide to get married. But what they don't count on is how to survive the honeymoon.

Title: 19. Friday the 13th: Part 3
Description: Jason Voorhees stalks a group of friends who have just arrived to spend the weekend at a cabin near Crystal Lake.

Title: 20. Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Description: Richard Pryor performs his stand-up comedy act on the Sunset Strip.

Title: 21. Tron
Description: A computer hacker is abducted into the digital world and forced to participate in gladiatorial games where his only chance of escape is with the help of a heroic security program.

Title: 22. Blade Runner
Description: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.

Title: 23. Young Doctors in Love
Description: In a zany parody of hospital soap operas, a new batch of doctors begins their internship at City Hospital.

Title: 24. Sophie's Choice
Description: Sophie is the survivor of Nazi concentration camps, who has found a reason to live with Nathan, a sparkling if unsteady American Jew obsessed with the Holocaust.

Title: 25. The World According to Garp
Description: A struggling young writer finds his life and work dominated by his unfaithful wife and his radical feminist mother, whose best-selling manifesto turns her into a cultural icon.

Title: 26. Victor/Victoria
Description: A struggling female soprano in 1934 Paris finally finds work after posing as a female impersonator, but it complicates her personal life when a visiting Chicago gangster finds himself inexplicably attracted to the seemingly male performer.

Title: 27. Airplane II: The Sequel
Description: A faulty computer causes a passenger space shuttle to head straight for the Sun. Can Ted Striker save the day and get the shuttle back on track - again?

Title: 28. Fast Times at Ridgemont High
Description: A group of SoCal high school students would rather ignore their studies and instead indulge in their teenage distractions.

Title: 29. Some Kind of Hero
Description: A Vietnam veteran returns home as a hero, but is quickly forgotten and discovers the harsh realities of survival in his own country.

Title: 30. Pink Floyd: The Wall
Description: A confined but troubled rock star descends into madness in the midst of his physical and social isolation from everyone.

Title: 31. Things Are Tough All Over
Description: Cheech and Chong are hired to drive a limo from Chicago to Las Vegas by two shady Arabs--Mr. Slyman (Cheech) and Prince Habib (Chong). Unbeknownst to them, five million dollars of dirty money has been stuffed throughout the car.

Title: 32. Night Shift
Description: A mild-mannered morgue attendant is assigned to the night shift, and his new coworker, along with his prostitute neighbor, convince him of running a prostitution ring out of the morgue.

Title: 33. Creepshow
Description: Five grisly tales from a kid's comic book about a murdered father rising from his grave, a bizarre meteor, a vengeful husband, a mysterious crate's occupant, and a plague of cockroaches.

Title: 34. The Man from Snowy River
Description: In 1880s Australia, after young Jim Craig's father dies, he takes a job at the Harrison cattle ranch, where he is forced to become a man.

Title: 35. Six Pack
Description: A race car driver is driving to a race in a motor home with his race car on a trailer. His car gets stripped of parts. He ends up with 6 orphan kids on his way to the race.

Title: 36. My Favorite Year
Description: An aging, dissolute matinee idol is slated to appear on a live TV variety show in 1954, and a young comedy writer is tasked with the thankless job of keeping him ready and sober for the broadcast.

Title: 37. The Thing
Description: A research team in Antarctica is hunted by a shape-shifting alien that assumes the appearance of its victims.

Title: 38. Deathtrap
Description: A struggling playwright invites a young writer to his home to discuss a script, but the meeting spirals into a deadly game of deception and betrayal.

Title: 39. Dead Men Don't Wear Plaid
Description: Film noir parody with a detective uncovering a sinister plot. Characters from classic noir films appear as scenes from various movies interjected into the story.

Title: 40. Zapped!
Description: A high school science nerd gains telekinetic powers after a laboratory accident and uses them for revenge upon bullies.

Title: 41. They Call Me Bruce
Description: A goofy Korean finds his life hopelessly complicated with people continually confusing him with Bruce Lee.

Title: 42. Death Wish II
Description: Architect Paul Kersey once again becomes a vigilante when he tries to find the five street punks who murdered his daughter and housekeeper, this time on the dark streets of Los Angeles.

Title: 43. Kiss Me Goodbye
Description: The ghost of a dead husband haunts his wife as she moves back to their house in NYC. She's about to marry an egyptologist there.

Title: 44. Grease 2
Description: A British student at a 1960s American high school must prove himself to the leader of a girls' gang whose members can only date greasers.

Title: 45. The Secret of NIMH
Description: To save her ill son, a field mouse must seek the aid of a colony of rats, with whom she has a deeper link than she suspected.

Title: 46. Halloween III: Season of the Witch
Description: Kids all over America want Silver Shamrock masks for Halloween. Doctor Daniel Challis seeks to uncover a plot by Silver Shamrock owner Conal Cochran.

Title: 47. Diner
Description: A group of college-age buddies struggle with their imminent passage into adulthood in 1959 Baltimore.

Title: 48. The Beastmaster
Description: A sword-and-sorcery fantasy about a young man's search for revenge. Armed with supernatural powers, the handsome hero and his animal allies wage war against marauding forces.

Title: 49. Missing
Description: When an idealistic American writer disappears during the Chilean coup d'état in September 1973, his wife and father try to find him.

Title: 50. The Entity
Description: A woman is tormented by an invisible being.

Title: 51. Visiting Hours
Description: A deranged, misogynistic killer assaults a journalist. When he discovers that she survived the attack, he follows her to the hospital to finish her off.

Title: 52. Vice Squad
Description: A single mother prostitute, who goes by the name Princess, finds herself forced to work undercover for the police in order to apprehend a homicidal, misogynistic pimp named Ramrod, who will do anything not to get arrested.

Title: 53. Author! Author!
Description: While facing the stress of his original play being produced on Broadway, playwright Ivan Travalian deals with having to raise his son, his stepdaughters, and his stepsons.

Title: 54. Amityville II: The Possession
Description: A dysfunctional family moves into a new house, which proves to be satanic, resulting in the demonic possession of their teenage son.

Title: 55. Monsignor
Description: An ambitious priest seduces a nun and leads the Vatican into shady business during and after World War II.

Title: 56. Making Love
Description: A successful young L.A. doctor and his equally successful television-producer wife find their happily-ever-after life torn assunder when he suddenly confronts his long-repressed attraction for other men. Zach and Claire live a comfortable life secure in their love for one another when Bart, a swinging L.A. novelist, walks into Zach's office and awakens unfamiliar feelings in him. In a move which leaves him wracked with guilt, Zach cancels dinner with his wife in order to go out with Bart. He is inexplicably drawn to this man who seems intent on keeping him at arms distance. Why can't Bart allow their relationship to grow? he wonders. Exasperated, he asks Bart, "Do you snore? Does anybody ever get a chance to find out?" As Zach's absences become more and more frequent, Claire's concern manifests itself in the suspicion that he is having an affair with another woman. Jilted by Bart and feeling alone for the first time in his married life, Zach resolves to tell Claire the truth about himself. Predictably, Claire is shocked that she could have known so little about the man she has loved for so many years and accuses him of deceiving her from the very start.

Title: 57. The Seduction
Description: A popular anchorwoman, Jaime Douglas, is stalked by a photographer who's obsessed with her and wants to win her affections at any cost.

Title: 58. The House on Sorority Row
Description: After a seemingly innocent prank goes horribly wrong, a group of sorority sisters are stalked and murdered one by one in their sorority house while throwing a party to celebrate their graduation.

Title: 59. Silent Rage
Description: A sheriff tries to stop the killing spree of a silent maniacal murderer who, as the result of secret genetic experimentation by an unethical scientist, has the ability to self-heal.

Title: 60. Savannah Smiles
Description: Savannah is the only child of a wealthy politician, Richard Driscoll, who is more concerned with his image and career than with his family.

Title: 61. The Year of Living Dangerously
Description: A young Australian reporter tries to navigate the political turmoil of Indonesia during the rule of President Sukarno with the help of a diminutive photographer.

Title: 62. Class Reunion
Description: It's been 10 years since Lizzie Borden High School's class of '72 graduated, and the preppies, the hippies and the in-crowd have returned to reminisce over good times past. Classmate Walter Baylor has returned too, but with a vengeance.

Title: 63. Hanky Panky
Description: Completely innocent man, Michael Jordon, is drawn into a web of government secrets when a girl carrying a mysterious package gets into a taxi with him. When she's later murdered, Michael becomes the chief suspect and goes on the run.

Title: 64. Shoot the Moon
Description: A mother of four is abandoned by her husband for a younger woman. Husband, wife and children struggle to survive the seemingly inevitable divorce.

Title: 65. A Midsummer Night's Sex Comedy
Description: In the early 20th century, wacky inventor Andrew Hobbs and his wife Adrian invite two other couples for a weekend party at their romantic summer house in the countryside in this paean to Ingmar Bergman's Smiles of a Summer Night.

Title: 66. Trail of the Pink Panther
Description: Journalist Marie Jouvet attempts to uncover the mysterious disappearance of Chief Inspector Jacques Clouseau.

Title: 67. If You Could See What I Hear
Description: A light comedy/love story based on the life of blind musician Tom Sullivan.

Title: 68. Night Crossing
Description: True tale about two men planning to escape from communist East Germany in a hot air balloon, but only if they can take their families with them.

Title: 69. The Pirate Movie
Description: A 1980s take-off of The Pirates of Penzance which centers on a noble pirate who leaves his profession and falls in love with a fiery young maiden.

Title: 70. The Beast Within
Description: A young woman gets raped by a mysterious man-creature, and years later her son begins a horrific transformation into a similar beast.

Title: 71. Tex
Description: After their mother dies and their father leaves them, teenage brothers Tex and Mason McCormick struggle to make it on their own.

Title: 72. The Missionary
Description: In the early 20th century, devout Reverend Charles Fortescue returns to England from his missionary work in Africa and, despite plans to marry his childhood sweetheart, receives a most unusual assignment: minister to the local prostitutes.

Title: 73. Cat People
Description: A woman who was orphaned from a young age finally reunites with her older brother. Matters start to go awry when she slowly discovers the true nature of her family.

Title: 74. I Ought to Be in Pictures
Description: Brooklynite Libby Tucker leaves her mother in Brooklyn to visit her screenwriter dad Herbert Tucker in L. A. She hasn't seen him for years and aspires to find a fast-paced life in movies. Along the way, Libby discovers who her dad is.

Title: 75. Fanny and Alexander
Description: Two young Swedish children in the 1900s experience the many comedies and tragedies of their lively and affectionate theatrical family, the Ekdahls.

Title: 76. Six Weeks
Description: In this heart-warming drama, a terminally ill young girl strives to bring together her wealthy mother and a California politician, fulfilling her dream of having a family during the last six weeks of her life.

Title: 77. Forced Vengeance
Description: A casino security guard is forced into violence from when the Hong Kong mob threatens his friends.

Title: 78. The Last Unicorn
Description: A beautiful unicorn sets out to learn if she truly is the last of her kind in this sparkling animated musical.

Title: 79. The Soldier
Description: Terrorists take over a plutonium bomb and threaten to detonate it in a Saudi Arabian oil field. A special anti-terrorist unit is sent in to stop them.

Title: 80. The Border
Description: A corrupt border Agent decides to clean up his act when an impoverished woman's baby is put up for sale on the black market.

Title: 81. Evil Under the Sun
Description: Agatha Christie's Belgian sleuth, Hercule Poirot, solves the murder of an actress at a Balkan resort.

Title: 82. Partners
Description: A heterosexual police detective is unnerved when ordered to go undercover with a homosexual police clerk, as a couple, to solve a series of murders in the gay community.

Title: 83. Still of the Night
Description: A Manhattan psychiatrist probes a patient's murder and falls for the victim's mysterious mistress.

Title: 84. The Last American Virgin
Description: Pizza delivery boy Gary, loudmouth David and hunky Rick are three high school students out to lose their virginity any way they can. Gary falls for transfer student Karen, who gets involved with Rick.

Title: 85. Megaforce
Description: Story about a rapid deployment defense unit that is called into action whenever freedom is threatened.

Title: 86. Personal Best
Description: The intertwined lives and loves of three highly ranked athletes striving for the national team; Chris bounces between the beds of male coach Terry and her female friend, competitor, and role model Tory.

Title: 87. Paradise
Description: In the Middle East in 1823, two teenagers seek refuge at an oasis, where they discover love and intimacy while staying one step ahead of the slaver who massacred their families.

Title: 88. The Grey Fox
Description: When an aging, but gentlemanly stagecoach robber is released from prison, he decides to go to Canada to become a train robber.

Title: 89. Cannery Row
Description: Monterey, California in the 1940's. Cannery Row - the section of town where the now closed fish canneries are located - is inhabited primarily by the down and out, although many would not move away even if they could. Probably the most upstanding citizen in the area is Doc, a marine biologist who earns a living primarily by collecting and selling marine specimens for research. He is a lost soul who is looking for his place in life. He is running away from his past, one where he is trying to make amends for what he considers a past wrong. But his current life isn't totally satisfying either. He believes that his recent collection of eight baby octopi will help him define that future in conducting research on their behavior. However, he is finding that research is not as easy as he had hoped, and that he is still feeling restless. Into the area comes drifter Suzy DeSoto. She too is a lost soul. With few job skills, she gets a job as what she calls a floozy in the local whorehouse, despite her openly headstrong demeanor not making her well suited to the work. Doc and Suzy are immediately attracted to each other, but theirs is a clash of personalities, despite each truly liking the other. The other residents of Cannery Row do their part for a Doc/Suzy coupling, not always with successful results. Doc and Suzy will first have to find their own lot in life before they can commit to someone else, be it the other or anyone else.

Title: 90. Heidi's Song
Description: Orphan Heidi lives with her grandpa in Swiss Alps. She brings joy to all there. However, her aunt takes her to the city to live as a servant girl to a cold rich strict family and their nice but sad handicapped daughter.

Title: 91. Vigilante
Description: After his wife and son got brutalized by a street gang, and a corrupt criminal justice system puts the perpetrators back on the street, a NYC factory worker teams up with a vigilante group to find some measure of bloody justice.

Title: 92. Tempest
Description: Unhappy middle-aged architect Philip Dimitrius leaves his wife Antonia and career for a spiritual awakening on a Greek island with his new girlfriend Aretha and teenage daughter, leading to extraordinary results for everyone around him.

Title: 93. Summer Lovers
Description: A young American couple and a French woman engage in a threesome in the Greek Islands.

Title: 94. Honkytonk Man
Description: A boy with a music talent goes on a journey with his uncle for a stage concert.

Title: 95. Mortuary
Description: Convinced that her father's death was not accidental, a beautiful girl decides to investigate to find out the truth, aided by her boyfriend. Her sleuthing draws her to a local mortuary, where many secrets will be revealed.

Title: 96. Let's Spend the Night Together
Description: The Rolling Stones' shows in Tempe, Arizona and East Rutherford, New Jersey during their 1981 US tour.

Title: 97. Jekyll and Hyde... Together Again
Description: Dr. Jekyll's research on a drug to avoid surgery yields a powder that transforms his timid self into a sexually uninhibited party animal, complicating his relationships with his fiancée and stripper girlfriend.

Title: 98. La Traviata
Description: Violetta meets Alfredo and quickly falls for him. After the lovers run away together, they live in bliss for a short time. However, Alfredo's father, Giorgio, starts to interfere, concerned that Violetta's bad reputation will affect the marriage prospects of Alfredo's sister. Violetta reluctantly leaves Alfredo, but his love is so strong that it leads him to actions that have tragic consequences.

Title: 99. The Return of Martin Guerre
Description: In medieval France, some villagers challenge a man's claim of identity when he (as he says) returns home from some time in the army.

Title: 100. Wrong Is Right
Description: A TV reporter finds himself in the middle of an Arab leader buying two portable nukes, terrorists, arms dealer, a reporter/CIA spy killed, a US president ordering a K-I-L-L etc.

Title: 101. Fighting Back
Description: A Philadelphia shop owner forms a civilian patrol to stop neighborhood crime. The patrol's actions are seen as racially discriminatory, leading to escalating conflict.

Title: 102. Penitentiary II
Description: An ex-con, on parole and trying to straighten his life out, decides to resume his boxing career when one of his prison enemies escapes and kills his girlfriend.

Title: 103. The Challenge
Description: A down-and-out American boxer becomes involved in a feud between two Japanese brothers.

Title: 104. Homework
Description: Good-looking but virginal "rockstar" teen Tommy tries to score with some of the local high school girls. But a classmate's mom decides to make a man out of him.

Title: 105. Jinxed!
Description: Bette Midler is on a roll through Reno, Vegas, and Tahoe with Rip Torn as her semi-professional gambler husband, and Ken Wahl as a seductive blackjack dealer. In HD.

Title: 106. The Final Option
Description: It's suspected that a peace/anti-nuke organization in UK has some extremists willing to use terrorism. The action will probably be against an embassy in London. The SAS/Special Air Service try to get the organization infiltrated.

Title: 107. It Came from Hollywood
Description: Popular comedians watch and give comments about the worst and silliest films from Hollywood.

Title: 108. The King of Comedy
Description: Rupert is an aspiring stand-up comedian, who is willing to go the extra mile in his attempt to appear in the late night show hosted by his idol.

Title: 109. A Stranger Is Watching
Description: The 11-year old daughter and girlfriend of a man whose wife had been raped and killed in front of his daughter three years earlier are kidnapped by the same killer. Held captive in a bunker below Grand Central Station, the two plot their escape while the police try to track the kidnapper.

Title: 110. A Little Sex
Description: The story of Michael Donovan's amusing - and doomed - attempts to wield life's ultimate double-edged sword: infidelity.

Title: 111. Yes, Giorgio
Description: Famous opera singer Giorgio Fini loses his voice during an American tour. He goes to female throat specialist Pamela Taylor and falls in love with her.

Title: 112. The Night of the Shooting Stars
Description: In 1944, the residents of a small Italian town under Axis control flee their homes to seek out the liberating Allied forces.

Title: 113. The Draughtsman's Contract
Description: A young artist is commissioned by the wife of a wealthy landowner to make a series of drawings of the estate while her husband is away.

Title: 114. Pieces
Description: The co-eds of a Boston college campus are targeted by a mysterious killer who is creating a human jigsaw puzzle from their body parts.

Title: 115. Barbarosa
Description: An inexperienced farm boy hooks up with a legendary outlaw in Mexico and both are soon on the run from the law, Mexican bandits, and two families bent on revenge.

Title: 116. Koyaanisqatsi
Description: A collection of expertly photographed phenomena with no conventional plot. The footage focuses on the relationship between nature, humanity, and technology.

Title: 117. I, the Jury
Description: A PI investigates the murder of his one-armed friend, a PI working on a case. Clues lead to a sex clinic. Bodies pile up.

Title: 118. Endangered Species
Description: A former New York City cop relocates to rural Colorado, where he teams with a sheriff investigating a series of bizarre cattle mutilations occurring in the region.

Title: 119. Turkey Shoot
Description: In a dystopian future where deviants are held in "re-education" camps, a freedom fighter and an innocent prisoner try to survive their decadent oppressors' game of kill-or-be-killed.

Title: 120. Losin' It
Description: Set in 1965, four rowdy teenage guys travel to Tijuana, Mexico for a night of partying when they are joined by a heartbroken housewife who is in town seeking a quick divorce.

Title: 121. Say Amen, Somebody
Description: Documentary about the American gospel music scene, focusing on two of the movement's pioneering forces, Thomas A. Dorsey and Willie May Ford Smith.

Title: 122. The Sender
Description: A disturbed telepathic man is unable to fully control his ability to transmit his dreams and visions into the minds of the people around him, or even influence reality. A female therapist tries to help him, but his mother gets in the way.

Title: 123. Lookin' to Get Out
Description: Alex has had a good day at the track, a bad night at the poker game and hell have a worse time if the guys he owes catch up with him. So Alex and go-along pal Jerry split for Las Vegas...

Title: 124. Enigma
Description: A CIA agent tries to infiltrate Soviet intelligence to stop a murderous diabolical plot.

Title: 125. Rendezvous in Paris
Description: Berlin 1920: Die seit sieben Jahren verheiratete Anwaltsgattin Evelyne Droste (Claude Jade) verliebt sich in den Amerikaner Frank Davis (Barry Stokes) und folgt ihm heimlich für ein Wochenende nach Paris. Damit setzt Evelyne ihre bürgerliche Existenz aufs Spiel. Nach dem Roman von Vicki Baum.

Title: 126. Come Back to the 5 & Dime Jimmy Dean, Jimmy Dean
Description: A fan club of die-hard James Dean fans meet on the 20th anniversary of his death and reconnect, opening old wounds and facing new ones.

Title: 127. L'étoile du Nord
Description: In 1934, a mysterious Frenchman returns to Europe from Egypt.

Title: 128. Lonely Hearts
Description: In this offbeat comedy, an unlikely romance develops between a flamboyant, middle-aged piano tuner and an extremely timid office worker.

Title: 129. The House Where Evil Dwells
Description: A young American family moves to a House in Kyoto, Japan. It turns out to be haunted by the ghosts of a woman and her lover, who were killed by the woman's husband, as well as the ghost of the husband, who killed himself afterward.

Title: 130. Britannia Hospital
Description: The chaotic workings of a hospital with staff on strike.

Title: 131. Monty Python Live at the Hollywood Bowl
Description: The Monty Python troupe perform a combination of classic sketches and new material at the Hollywood Bowl.

Title: 132. I'm Dancing as Fast as I Can
Description: A true story about Emmy-winning documentary filmmaker Barbara Gordon's Valium addiction and her desperate attempts to kick the habit.

Title: 133. Split Image
Description: A rising star young gymnast is lured into a religious cult by a beautiful girl. Every moment with the group brings him more and more under the control of the cult's leader.

Title: 134. Five Days One Summer
Description: An aging doctor takes his beautiful young mistress on an alpine walking holiday only to find that she is falling for the charms of a dashing tour guide, but there is a dark secret that looms over the couple.

Title: 135. The Escape Artist
Description: Teenager Danny Masters, the son of the late Harry Masters, considered the second best escape artist in history, wants to follow in his father's footsteps, he already a skilled but untested magician. As far as Danny knows, his father died in a dangerous escape routine. Escaping from under his grandmother's roof, Danny, in a step to achieve his goal as they have all his father's old professional paraphernalia, reunites with his Aunt Sibyl and Uncle Burke in the town of Harding where they have a mind-reading act, she who actually can read minds but which only impinges on the smoke and mirrors they've developed with the act itself. In his wanderings around Harding, Danny gets involved with corrupt Stu Quiñones, and indirectly with Stu's equally corrupt father, the town's mayor, Leon Quiñones. This father/son pair no longer associate with each other as although Stu aspires to be as corrupt as his father, Stu's activities are a little too brazen and public for a politician with which to deal. In those dealings, Danny devises what is largely seen as a publicity stunt in reality to get the one up on the Quiñoneses, but in which he will have to show his true mettle as a great escape artist. In the process, Danny may also provide some justice for his father, the true nature of his death which Danny learns along the way.

Title: 136. Bugs Bunny's 3rd Movie: 1001 Rabbit Tales
Description: Rival book salesmen Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck are forced by Sultan Yosemite Sam to read fairy tales to his spoiled, selfish son, Prince Abba-Dabba.

Title: 137. Movie Madness
Description: An anthology parody of film genres composed of three shorts, spoofing personal growth films, glossy soap operas, and police stories.

Title: 138. White Dog
Description: A trainer attempts to retrain a vicious dog that's been raised to attack black people.

Title: 139. The Masters of Time
Description: Piel, a 7 or 8 year old boy, is alone on the desert planet Perdide, only survivor of an attack by giant hornets. Calling for help, Piel's father's friend Jaffar keeps contact with the kid and hurries across space toward Perdide.

Title: 140. Hammett
Description: Fictional account of real-life mystery writer Dashiell Hammett, and his involvement in the investigation of a beautiful Chinese cabaret actress' mysterious disappearance in San Francisco.

Title: 141. Cane River
Description: The romance between two African Americans who come from a different class background.

Title: 142. Ladies and Gentlemen, the Fabulous Stains
Description: The media and disaffected teens mistake the acerbic rants of an obnoxious teenage punk rocker as a rallying cry for the women of America, launching her and her talentless group to national stardom.

Title: 143. Kamikaze 89
Description: In a totalitarian society of the future, in which the government controls all facets of the press, a homicide detective investigates a string of bombings, and finds out more than he bargained for.

Title: 144. The Atomic Cafe
Description: Disturbing collection of 1940s and 1950s United States government-issued propaganda films designed to reassure Americans that the atomic bomb was not a threat to their safety.

Title: 145. Veronika Voss
Description: Partially based on the life of Sybille Schmitz, who found fame under the Nazi regime, but whose career was destroyed afterward. Veronika Voss is a once prominent UFA actress, kept by her doctor, who raises suspicion in a sports journalist.

Title: 146. Losing Ground
Description: Sara, a cold college professor, and her husband, an ecstatic painter, spend a summer away from the city, straining their rocky relationship.

Title: 147. The Slumber Party Massacre
Description: A female high school student's slumber party turns into a bloodbath, as a newly escaped psychotic serial killer wielding a power drill prowls her neighborhood.

Title: 148. Forbidden World
Description: In the distant future, a federation marshal arrives at a research lab on a remote planet where a genetic experiment has gotten loose and begins feeding on the dwindling scientific group.

Title: 149. Bloodtide
Description: An adventurer hunting for treasure in Greece accidentally frees a monster that forces local villagers to sacrifice virgins.

Title: 150. Fitzcarraldo
Description: The story of Brian Sweeney Fitzgerald, an extremely determined man who intends to build an opera house in the middle of a jungle.

Title: 151. Swamp Thing
Description: After a violent incident with a special chemical, a research scientist is turned into a swamp plant monster.

Title: 152. Basket Case
Description: A young man carrying a big basket that contains his extremely deformed, formerly conjoined twin brother seeks vengeance on the doctors who separated them against their will.

Title: 153. Tenebrae
Description: An American novelist visiting Rome to promote his latest book is stalked and harassed by an obsessed fan who is committing a string of murders that appear to be tributes to his work.

Title: 154. Class of 1984
Description: A new teacher at a troubled inner-city high school soon ends up clashing with a delinquent punk posse who run the institute with an iron fist.

Title: 155. Sorceress
Description: Sword and sorcery story of the cosmic struggle between white magic and black magic.

Title: 156. Unhinged
Description: Three young women who crash their car during a rainstorm are taken in by a bizarre family at their large, rural estate.

Title: 157. Love Strange Love
Description: In 1937, in São Paulo, 12-year-old Hugo comes from Santa Catarina. His grandmother is returning him to his mother, Anna, who is now with Osmar, the most influential politician in the state.

Title: 158. Piranha II: The Spawning
Description: A scuba diving instructor, her biochemist boyfriend, and her police chief ex-husband try to link a series of bizarre deaths to a mutant strain of piranha fish whose lair is a sunken freighter ship off a Caribbean island resort.

Title: 159. The New York Ripper
Description: A burned-out New York police detective teams up with a college psychoanalyst to track down a vicious serial killer randomly stalking and killing various young women around the city.

Title: 160. The Aftermath
Description: An astronaut battles mutant cannibals after returning from space to find Earth ravaged by nuclear and biological war.

Title: 161. Los ritos sexuales del diablo
Description: A young woman travels to England after the abrupt death of her brother. Staying with her sister-in-law, she finds her companion soon drawn into a satanic cult based in the house, whose rites seem to centre on large-scale sexual congress.

Title: 162. Parasite
Description: In a post-apocalyptic USA, a doctor/scientist infected with a new strain of parasite ends up in a small desert town, trying to find a cure.

Title: 163. Querelle
Description: A handsome sailor is drawn into a vortex of sibling rivalry, murder, and explosive sexuality.

Title: 164. Q: The Winged Serpent
Description: NYPD detectives Shepard and Powell are working on a bizarre case of a ritualistic Aztec murder. Meanwhile, something big is attacking people of New York and only greedy small time crook Jimmy Quinn knows where its lair is.

Title: 165. Liquid Sky
Description: A small, heroin-seeking UFO lands on a Manhattan roof, observes a bizarre, drug-addicted fashion model, and sucks endorphin from her sexual encounters' brains.

Title: 166. The Inconfessable Orgies of Emmanuelle
Description: Emmanuelle is recently reunited with her husband, but at the next party, she gets drunk and strips nude for his friends. He returns to his lover. Later, a sober Emmanuelle tries to redeem herself, but her husband refuses to forgive.

Title: 167. Xtro
Description: An alien creature impregnates a woman who gives birth to a man who was abducted by aliens three years ago. The man reconnects with his wife and son for a sinister purpose.

Title: 168. Hey Good Lookin'
Description: An outrageous, affectionate look at coming of age in Eisenhower-era Brooklyn.

Title: 169. Eating Raoul
Description: A relatively boring Los Angeles couple discovers a bizarre, if not murderous, way to get funding for opening a restaurant.

Title: 170. Frances
Description: The story of Frances Farmer's meteoric rise to fame in Hollywood and the tragic turn her life took when she was blacklisted.

Title: 171. The Plague Dogs
Description: Two dogs escape from a laboratory and are hunted as possible carriers of the bubonic plague.

Title: 172. The Last Horror Film
Description: A New York taxi driver stalks a beautiful actress attending the Cannes Film Festival, which coincides with a series of violent killings of the lady's friends.

Title: 173. Raw Force
Description: Martial arts students visit an island with ghosts of dishonored fighters. They encounter a Hitler lookalike running a female slavery operation, leading to encounters with cannibals, piranhas, zombies, and chaos.

Title: 174. Wacko
Description: Thirteen years after the "Lawnmower Killer" killed her sister, high school student Mary Graves and obsessed detective Dick Harbinger are on the lookout for the killer to reappear during the annual Halloween Pumpkin Prom.

Title: 175. The Beach Girls
Description: Two young women convince their reluctant friend to open up her rich uncle's beach house for the summer to party, and invite all their friends.

Title: 176. One Dark Night
Description: As part of an initiation into a club called the Sisters, a young girl must spend the night in a mausoleum.

Title: 177. Alone in the Dark
Description: A few dangerous and delusional mental patients break out of a mental asylum during a power blackout, and lay siege to their new doctor's house, who, they believe, killed their previous doctor.

Title: 178. Satan's Baby Doll
Description: In the crypt of the remote castle of the Aguilars lies the recently-deceased body of Maria. Her husband Antonio is a jealous bully, his mute brother Ignazio is in a wheelchair peeping on his caretaker Sol, a novice. Also present are Miria, the couple's virginal daughter, and Isidro, a factotum who fears Satan's power. A frequent visitor is Juan Suarez, a doctor who wants Miria in a sanatorium for a month. She doesn't want to go. Isidro tries to exorcize the castle's evil spirits. Bodies pile up. Is Miria's mother truly dead, and who is Satan's tool?

Title: 179. Identification of a Woman
Description: A director's wife leaves him. He pursues another woman who also departs. This inspires a movie idea about women's relationships. He searches for an actress to star in the film and his life.

Title: 180. The Black Room
Description: A serially unfaithful businessman rents a spare room from two siblings to use for his sexual conquests, unaware that they're serial killers who murder every woman he brings there.

Title: 181. Mansion of the Living Dead
Description: A group of vacationing waitresses visit a resort hotel on the Canary Islands, only to find that the former monastery's monks nearby have returned as living blind dead.

Title: 182. Pandemonium
Description: A former high school student who always wanted to be a cheerleader decides to reopen the cheerleading program at her former high school after years of closure for being targeted by a serial killer.

Title: 183. The Junkman
Description: Junkman and movie-maker Harlan Hollis struggles to stay alive when a jealous partner in his company hires goons to kill him. Full of amazing car chases, fantastic crashes, and edge-of-your-seat action.

Title: 184. The Simple-Minded Murderer
Description: A mentally challenged man escapes from his tyrannical master and finds happiness when a poor family takes him in.

Title: 185. Waitress!
Description: Three lovely waitresses contend with a drunken, slovenly chef and mutinous patrons.

Title: 186. Humongous
Description: A woman's son, born after a traumatic assault, grows into a monstrous killer haunting a group of shipwrecked teenagers stranded on his island.

Title: 187. Android
Description: A strange doctor secretly experiments with androids on his space station. His assistant is Max, a curious android who wants to see the world and meet a girl. Criminals hide on their station and soon violence erupts.

Title: 188. Space Adventure Cobra
Description: After two years in hiding, a famed space pirate with a "psychogun" for a left arm joins a bounty huntress on a quest to save her world, only to find himself battling an old enemy.

Title: 189. Midnight
Description: A young woman fleeing her sexually abusive stepfather hitches a ride with two young men, but the three soon find themselves at the mercy of a backwoods Satanic cult.

Title: 190. For Tor's Sake
Description: Thor's father drinks, and Thor escapes to the woods and refuses to come home before he quits drinking. Lucky for Thor he has a lot of friends who help him.

Title: 191. A Whole Night
Description: Following over two dozen different people in the almost wordless atmosphere of a dark night in a Brussels town, Akerman examines acceptance and rejection in the realm of romance.

Title: 192. 1990: The Bronx Warriors
Description: In a post-apocalyptic New York City, a policeman infiltrates the Bronx, which has become a battleground for several murderous street gangs.

Title: 193. Girls Nite Out
Description: At a remote Ohio college, a killer dressed in the school's bear mascot suit stalks several young women participating in an all-night scavenger hunt.

Title: 194. Violence in a Women's Prison
Description: Photojournalist Emanuelle goes undercover into a woman's prison, where she discovers and experiences the abuse, torture and humiliation the inmates are subjected to.

Title: 195. The Shaolin Temple
Description: A young man, hounded by a psychopathic general, learns martial arts at the Shaolin temple to avenge his father's death. To achieve this he forgoes a budding romance with his kungfu master's daughter, a shepherdess.

Title: 196. Next of Kin
Description: In a rest home for elderly people, a daughter reads her mother's diary. Soon events that are mentioned in the mother's diary begin to happen to the daughter.

Title: 197. Yol
Description: The difficulties experienced by five prisoners who took a weeks leave from prison.

Title: 198. The Fan
Description: The hero-worship that Simone has for a pop singer is built to a crescendo until she passes out when she finally sees him up-close in a crowd of fans. She is later shocked when he lets her know that he does not love her.

Title: 199. Ator: The Fighting Eagle
Description: The son of Torren learns of his heritage, goes to avenge the deaths of his fellow villagers, and rescue his sister from the evil Dakkar and his spider cult.

Title: 200. The Living Dead Girl
Description: A toxic spill revives a beautiful, dead heiress who, with the help of her childhood friend, must quench her insatiable thirst for blood.
